newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends flat, recovers early losses.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends flat, recovers early losses.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka recovered from early falls and closed flat at 42.5480/5485 to the dollar in interbank trading, brokers said.
The local unit was quoted weaker at 42.5480/5495 per dollar in early trade but gained later with increasing selling offers.
"Sellers were bargaining at the beginning but they softened their stance later to square positions ahead of the (Moslem) Friday weekened," said one dealer.
Call money was traded at 4.75-5.5 percent, down slightly from Wednesday's 5.0-5.5 percent close, dealers said.
